column4: A grilled fish.  Reminds you of your mother’s cooking. Sure to raise anyone’s spirits!
A soup with apples and mushrooms as its broth.  It’s warmth penetrates through your cold, quiet exterior and gives you a feeling of homeliness.
A simple soup made with carrots and water.  Carrot-y!
A salad mixed with oyster mushrooms and nodding onions.  Easy to make, which is a welcome change right now.
a hearty soup made with the meat you found in the cave.  The meat in it is a bit tough, but it’s the best you can do with what you have.
Tasty looking crackers made from bay nuts and calamint. They also increase the body’s natural healing, so they’re great for healing minor aches and pains.
An omelet with nodding onions inside.  A staple meal, and one that is surprisingly tasty.
A bunch of dried wolfberries.  Due to its strong flavor, no other ingredients are needed.
A delicious thimbleberry pie.  It’s very hard to make, but sometimes you have to treat yourself for surviving during these times.
